resources.string: Sommières is a beautiful historic town with ancient origins, situated in the valley of the Vidourle river half way between Montpellier and Nimes, and surrounded by the vineyards of the Gard, department of Languedoc-Roussillon. Throughout its history, Sommières has remained a thriving industrial city, working on textiles (a cloth formerly known as Sommières) and famous for its aromatic essences. So sit back and relax while we show you around some of the best features of Sommières. We have also linked to a blog below and some videos uploaded to YouTube.
The most important historic monument in Sommieres is the bridge across the river, dating from the 1st century

The town and its magnificent castle overlook the Vidourle river plain. The castle tower dates back to the 10th century whereas the main part of the castle was renovated in the Renaissance style at the end of the 16th century.
25th edition. Faithful to its commitments Jazz in Junas goes always and again to meet all audiences to give pleasure and discover jazz in all its forms.
From Sommières to Caveirac, in the outskirts of Nîmes, the green trail allows for an outdoor excursion in pleasant and safe conditions.
Welcome to the Roc de Massereau, the adventure park of Sommières Montpellier et Nîmes.
